name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Navigator Inn & Suites

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel! The hotel is very clean and nicely updated. It has all the amenities you could ask for and everything was complimentary. The hotel staff was very accommodating to all the requests that I had and were very very helpful. I needed a shuttle to drop a car off at a private residence and they provided this without hesitation. I also needed help with airport transportation, the hotel does not ofer this as the airport is a considerable distance, but we're able to make the arrangements for me. I would not hesitate to stay with them on a return trip!!!
reviews.title: Excellent stat

reviews.text: Guadalupe does an outstanding job with her service, attendtion and extra everything on the drinks & food service!
reviews.title: great service

reviews.text: Holly was great help in helping getting my boarding pass online as there was a problen with the computer, but she did it & got it up & working to get me my boarding pass.
reviews.title: Wonderfull Stay!

reviews.text: Natividad was very nice about doing my room that was ahead of her schedual for me.
reviews.title: Enjoyable BW Plus in Everett

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can say everyone was very friendly & helpful and I will stay there again.
reviews.title: AWESOME

reviews.text: Very clean. Excellent staff. Above average room. (Stayed in a 2 Queen) Breakfast area is a bit cramped. Double automatic sliding doors was an issue travelling with a 2-year-old. Location is OK.
reviews.title: Clean with very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful staff

reviews.text: We booked the B/W Plus for one nite, and when checking in, to our surprise, were upgraded to a suite. We found the rooms to be clean, spacious, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was great with plenty of variety. The bed was king-size and very comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and approachable. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who needed this area of Everett for their needs.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a king bed suit for one night and were upgraded to a suit. WOW!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom had a raised jacuzzi tub in the sorner which was big enough for 2 people and the TV swiveled to view it from the bath. As well as this there was a comfortable living room and full kitchen.
reviews.title: Good location
Always Awesome
reviews.text: They have courtesy wine and snacks in the evening and a free hot breakfast.

I enjoyed my stay here. The room was very clean, quiet and comfortable, and had a small kitchen in it. I also found the bed to be very comfortable. The afternoon snack was a nice surprise and the breakfast was excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only negative (small negative) was that the parking lot was full and I had to park farther away from the building than I wanted to.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for visit to Boeing factory tour. They claimed they are newly renovated but basically you can tell how badly worn it used to be. We stayed on 1st floor. Bad insulation and noisy neighbors from next door and upstairs. We asked to have a room in new wing and they said they are full, but right next to me, they offered an upgrade to a couple and asked them which floor they preferred. Lots of kids running around and took over both computers (kids under 16 supposed to be supervised by adults but no one reinforced). Pool is tiny, gym has only 4 machines. Beds were worn with badly washed down comforter (that explained the clumpy looks from other travelers' photos) Kitchenette looks old, cabinets has stained - not sure if they are old or just not cleaned thoroughly. Breakfast is a disaster - too little room for too many users. No one maintain during the breakfast hour so floors are full of scrap, all utensils handles are sticky, I felt like I am sitting in a badly managed fast food place. I picked this place because it is a BW plus and they claimed they are very close to Boeing, but Hilton Garden Inn is RIGHT NEXT to Boeing and appeared to be a lot newer. I am okay if they did not claim themselves as a BW plus so I know what to expect!
reviews.title: It is NOT a BW Plus!

reviews.text: My family thoroughly enjoyed our stay at your hotel. Great hot breakfast, all day coffee and tea in the lobby and evening wine/beer and snacks. Our room was clean and quiet and it had a small kitchen with a full sized fridge.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The staff would go out of their way to answer questions or give recommendations on places to visit.
reviews.title: A great drive from Vancouver!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An added bonus was the no charge laundry facilities for the guest to use. I have recommended this hotel to my friends.
reviews.title: 3 day stay

reviews.text: We came down from Calgary for a three day shopping/ R&R trip and choose this hotel and were extremely impressed! It's about 1/2 hr from Seattle and worth the drive. The rates were extremely reasonable, the rooms were clean and had everything we needed and more (we got a suite) and the staff were very friendly and helpful! The suite had a comfy bed, full kitchette, 2 tv's one in the room and one in the bedroom. The room had a wall safe.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!! Awesome value for you dollar!!

reviews.text: The hotel offers a free business centre, nice pool and hot tub and a good gym. The morning continental breakfast was great! So many choices and had a different feature everyday. On weeknights they offer a free happy hour with drinks and appies! So impressed! The hotel is blocks away from restaurants and the Everett mall and about a 15 minute drive north on the I-5, is Seattle Premium Outlets.
reviews.title: What a great place to stay

reviews.text: We were very impressed with this hotel and would stay again when we come down again. We would highly recommend paying the extra for the suite!
reviews.title: Close to Everything!

reviews.text: PS-look at the awning at the entrance way, one of the coolest we have ever seen!
reviews.title: A Great Hotel Overall

reviews.text: I stayed at the Best Western -Navigator for 46 days on business and I can't say enough great about everything. The facility is well maintained with maintenance staff and housekeeping constantly working to keep the hotel clean and operational. The buildings are kept up to date with flat screen TVs and wired internet and WiFi.
reviews.title: Best Western just doesn't cut it....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights in a single room on the second floor, right next to one of the elevators. The room was L-shaped and nicely appointed, with flatscreen TV, mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, and a small desk area with wired Internet access. The clock radio next to the bed accepted input from my MP-3 player, which was an unexpected and pleasant discovery. The bathroom was tiny, but nicely renovated. The toilet seemed to be jet-powered -- it flushed with a very loud whoosh, like a vacuum toilet in an airplane or cruise ship. We had some noise from the elevator adjacent to our room door -- it chimed when the elevator arrived, and buzzed when riders pressed buttons -- but it wasn't too intrusive. The room was spotless but it took until after 4:00 for the room to be tidied the next day, which was surprising. The breakfast offerings were impressive: fresh fruit, do-it-yourself waffles, oatmeal, boiled eggs, toast, juices, yogurt... and the breakfast room/lobby was modern and pleasant. I would definitely stay again. Be warned that the signage for the property is difficult to see from Evergreen Way; you may be upon the property and beyond it before you realize it.
reviews.title: Nice property; great breakfast

aka: Best Western Plus Navigator Hotel Everett
